name: The Mirror of Galadriel Rules
text: “Many things I can command the Mirror to reveal, and to some I can show what they desire to see.” — Galadriel, The Fellowship of the Ring Welcome to The Mirror of Galadriel, an unofficial fan Scenario, developed by A Long-extended Party (ALeP). This customizable quest of nightmarish difficulty explores some alternative visions the hobbits may have seen in the Mirror of Galadriel. Component Overview The Mirror of Galadriel Scenario includes 106 cards, consisting of:  • 4 Rules Cards • 4 Quest Cards  • 12 Player Cards • 1 Contract Card  • 59 Encounter Cards • 24 Boon Cards  • 2 Promo Hero Cards Web Resources You can check for any updates from A Long-extended Party at www.alongextendedparty.com. You can build decks and track your plays of these scenarios and others online through RingsDB at www.ringsdb.com.

name: The Mirror of Galadriel 1
text: Expansion Symbol The cards in The Mirror of Galadriel Scenario can be identified by this symbol before each card’s collector number. Modular Scenario The Mirror of Galadriel is a modular scenario. Each playthrough will involve 4 modules: a scenario module, a villain module, a wave 1 module, and a wave 2 module. In this product, we provide a single scenario module and a villain module. The wave modules are constructed using other FFG and ALeP products, as indicated on the corresponding objective cards. A complete card pool is not necessary to play - just enough to construct a wave 1 and wave 2 module. In this product you will find 3 encounter sets. The first is The Mirror of Galadriel, which contains the objective cards that are used to incorporate the modules. The second is The Mirror of Galadriel - Gondor, corresponding to the scenario module. The third is The Mirror of Galadriel - Sauron, corresponding to the villain module. The icons for these encounter sets, respectively, are:

name: The Mirror of Galadriel 2
text: Rules & New Terms Defense The defense keyword first appeared in the Helm’s Deep scenario by FFG, and the full rules for the keyword can be found in the associated rules. As a brief refresher, while the current quest has the defense keyword and the players quest successfully, they do not place progress (not even on an active location), but if they quest unsuccessfully, the first player places progress on the quest (with active locations as a buffer) equal to difference between the staging [threat] and committed [willpower]. New rule: While the main quest has the defense keyword, side quests cannot be chosen as the current quest. Turncoat The turncoat keyword first appeared in the Strange News in Bree scenario by ALeP, and the full rules for the keyword can be found in the associated rules. As a brief refresher, a character with turncoat loses their card type and tokens. They gain the enemy card type, their text box is considered blank, and they engage their former controller, with [threat] equal to their [willpower].

name: The Mirror of Galadriel 3
text: Each player’s active location The Siege of Middle-earth objective says that each player can have an active location. This means that during the travel phase, instead of the group choosing one location, each player without an active location may, in turn order, travel to a separate location. The word “you” in a location’s Travel cost refers only to the player travelling to it. After a player travels, the location is placed in their play area instead of next to the quest. Active locations still act as buffers for progress placed on the quest. The first player distributes that progress among active locations in any way they like. Progress may only go on the quest once all active locations are explored, unless they are explicitly bypassed. If a player card effect refers to “the active location”, it means the active location of the player that controls that card. Retreat X Retreat X represents your heroes falling back from their active location under enemy assault. When triggered, place X progress on your active location. If this exceeds that location’s quest points (or if you have no active location), place the excess directly on the main quest, bypassing other players’ active locations.

name: The Mirror of Galadriel 4
text: Formidable The formidable keyword is shorthand for the following effects: • Immune to player card effects. • Cannot leave the staging area unless it is destroyed. • Considered to be engaged with each player. • Shadow cards dealt to this enemy are immune to  player card effects. Deserter The deserter keyword is fully defined on Sauron’s card: characters with the deserter keyword lose their Traits. Earning a Boon The Mirror of Galadriel is a very difficult scenario, and players are not expected to win on the first attempt. Instead, players will earn boons during their attempts. When a player earns a boon, they choose a set-aside boon and put it into play, then record it in their own “Mirror log.” On your next playthrough of The Mirror of Galadriel, stage 1B instructs the players to put the boons in their Mirror log into play. A player’s Mirror log persists even if that player changes heroes. Some boons reference the number of boons you have earned—this always refers to a specific player’s Mirror log, not to the group.

name: The Mirror of Galadriel 5
text: The Mirror log is tied to the Villain objective. At present, only one Villain objective exists, but future releases may require separate Mirror logs for each one. Easy Mode There are no cards removed for easy mode here, as the quest is designed to become easier as boons are earned. However, if players prefer an easier initial experience, or wish to avoid repeated playthroughs, they may use this easy mode rule: Ignore the Forced effect on Siege of Middle-earth during even-numbered rounds. Competitive Mode The Mirror of Galadriel supports an optional competitive mode. To begin, split the players into groups. Each group must choose the same Scenario and Villain objective. For the Wave objectives, each group can make their own selections freely or they can perform a draft among the Wave objectives where the groups are ordered randomly and each group must select a different wave. Reverse the order of the groups between Wave 1 and Wave 2 when drafting. If there are only 2 groups, they can also perform a draft where each group chooses the Wave objectives for the opposing group.

name: The Mirror of Galadriel 6
text: Competitive mode involves just a single game session, so each group will play in easy mode with no Mirror log. The winning group is determined as follows: 1. If only one group wins the scenario, they are the  overall winner. 2. If multiple groups win the scenario, the group with  the fewest progress on stage 4B is the overall winner. 3. If no group wins the scenario, each group divides the  damage on the Villain enemy by the number of  players in their group. The group with the highest  result is the winner. 4. If there is still a tie, select the groups that advanced  to the furthest quest stage. Among those groups,  the group with the fewest progress on their quest  stage is the winner. FAQ Q: When exactly does the Before Player Setup text of quest card 1A trigger during Setup? A: It triggers after players choose their starting heroes and assemble their decks, but before they start to resolve all the Setup text on their heroes and player cards. If you follow the Reworked Setup proposed by ALeP, this happens at the end of Step 2.

name: The Mirror of Galadriel 7
text: Q: How does a player card like The Will of Ilúvatar, which says “An enemy cannot be immune to this effect” interact with the Formidable keyword, which says the enemy is immune to player card effects? A: These two effects are in direct contradiction, so we look to the official FAQ item 1.14: “If a card effect uses the word ‘cannot’, then it is an absolute: that effect cannot be overridden by other effects.” Therefore, the enemy can indeed be affected. Q: Is a deserter character still considered to have printed Traits for card effects purposes, such as Tribute to the Dark Lord? A: Yes. When a card gains or loses traits due to a card effect, it does not alter what is actually printed on the card. Q: Can The One Ring player card (ASiTE 1) be used in this scenario? No, as this scenario provides its own version of The One Ring. However, players are free to use Master cards with the provided version.

name: Galadriel
text: Galadriel cannot quest, attack, or defend. Allies you control do not exhaust to commit to the quest during the round they enter play. Action: Exhaust Galadriel to choose a player. That player reduces their threat by 1 and draws 1 card. (Limit once per round.)

name: Denethor
text: Setup: Add 2 resources to Denethor’s resource pool. Action: Move 1 resource from Denethor’s resource pool to another Gondor hero’s resource pool. (Limit once per round.)

name: Silver Belt
text: Attach to a Silvan or Hobbit hero. Limit 1 per hero. Response: After a character you control leaves play, exhaust Silver Belt to give attached hero +1 [attack] and +1 [defense] until the end of the round.

name: Phial of Galadriel
text: Attach to a Hobbit hero. Response: Discard Phial of Galadriel to cancel a shadow effect just triggered during an attack made by an enemy engaged with you. Give the attached hero +1 [attack] and +1 [defense] until the end of the phase.

name: Golden Hair
text: Attach to a Dwarf hero. Limit 3 copies of Golden Hair in the victory display. Action: Add Golden Hair to the victory display to reduce your threat by 3.

name: Sword-sheath
text: Attach to a [tactics] hero. Limit 1 per hero. Response: After attached hero destroys an enemy engaged with you, exhaust Sword-sheath and a Weapon attachment on the attached hero to draw 1 card.

name: Things that Yet May Be
text: Before Player Setup: Add Siege of Middle-earth and The One Ring to the staging area. From The Mirror of Galadriel encounter set, choose a Scenario and a Villain objective. Then choose a Wave 1 and a Wave 2 objective that reference products a player owns in their collection (random selection for the waves is encouraged, but not required). Remove any unchosen objectives from the game. Resolve the Setup effects on the 4 chosen objectives. Do not flip this card over until the end of Setup.

name: Things that Yet May Be
text: When Revealed: Set aside, out of play, each Tier 1 and Tier 2 boon, then each player may put any number of boons from their Mirror log into play. If you are playing easy mode, each player may now earn 1 random Tier 1 boon. Advance to stage 2A.

name: The First Wave
text: When Revealed: Search the encounter deck for 1 Wall location and reveal it (2 Wall locations instead if there are 3 or more players in the game). Shuffle the encounter deck. Reveal the set-aside Wave 1 card and make the Wave 1 deck the current wave deck.

name: The First Wave
text: Forced: After the last time token is removed from this stage, distribute X damage among characters in play. X is the amount of progress here. If X is less than 5[pp] and the Commander enemy with the Wave 1 trait is not in play, each player may earn 1 random Tier 1 boon. Advance to the next stage.

name: The Second Wave
text: When Revealed: Shuffle the Wave 1 deck and the encounter discard pile into the encounter deck. Reveal the set-aside Wave 2 card and make the Wave 2 deck the current wave deck.

name: The Second Wave
text: Commander enemies are immune to player card effects. Forced: After the last time token is removed from this stage, distribute X damage among characters in play. X is the amount of progress here. If X is less than 5[pp] and the Commander enemy with the Wave 2 trait is not in play, each player may choose and earn 1 Tier 1 or Tier 2 boon. Advance to the next stage.

name: The Villain
text: When Revealed: Shuffle the Wave 2 deck and the encounter discard pile into the encounter deck. Reveal the set-aside Villain card and make the Villain deck the current wave deck.

name: The Villain
text: X is 10[pp]. While there are any Commander enemies in play, the Villain enemy cannot take damage. When this stage is defeated, or when the last time token is removed from this stage, the players lose the game.

name: Ring-bound Soldiers
text: Response: When you would trigger retreat X, the Ring-lord player may exhaust The One Ring to reduce the X value by 2.

name: Chance Meeting
text: Attach to a hero. Limit 1 per hero. Action: Add Chance Meeting to the victory display to search your deck for a card and add it to your hand. Shuffle your deck. If you have earned at least 5 boons, you may play or put into play that card for no cost.

name: Drop of Miruvor
text: Attach to a hero. Action: Add Drop of Miruvor to the victory display to (choose 1): ready attached hero, add 1 resource to the attached hero’s pool, draw 2 cards, or reduce your threat by 3.

name: Mallorn Bow
text: Attach to a hero. Restricted. Limit 1 per hero. Attached hero gains ranged and gets +1 [attack] (+2 [attack] instead if you are the only player).

name: The Lady’s Favor
text: Attach to a hero. Limit 1 per hero. Attached hero gets +1 [willpower], +1 [attack], and +1 [defense] (+2 to each attribute instead if you have earned at least 5 boons).

name: A New Alliance
text: Attach to a hero. Limit 1 per player. Each character you control gets +1 [defense]. If you have earned at least 5 boons, each character you control gets +1 [attack].

name: Flask of Miruvor
text: Attach to a hero. Action: Add Flask of Miruvor to the victory display to choose up to 3 copies of Drop of Miruvor in the victory display and attach them to heroes you control.

name: Eagles are Coming!
text: Attach to a hero. Limit 1 per player. Action: If it is the 6th round, add Eagles are Coming! to the victory display to search your collection for an Eagle ally and put it into play under any player’s control. Repeat this effect an additional time for each hero in your discard pile.

name: The Will of Ilúvatar
text: Attach to your play area. Limit 1 per player. Response: When you declare an attack against a Villain enemy, it gets –X [defense] for that attack. X is the number of boons you have earned. Villain enemies cannot be immune to this effect.

name: Word of Healing
text: Attach to a hero. Action: Add Word of Healing to the victory display to choose a hero in any player’s discard pile and put it into play, under its owner’s control (without turncoat if it had it when it left play). That hero’s owner may attach up to 2 attachments from their discard pile to it.

name: Siege of Middle-earth
text: Each player can have an active location. Forced: At the beginning of the staging step, each player in turn order reveals the top card of the current wave deck as if it was revealed from the encounter deck (surge will reveal cards from the encounter deck). If that card is an enemy, the player who revealed it can immediately optionally engage it.

name: The Ring Comes to Gondor
text: Setup: Choose a starting hero (a Gondor hero, if able) and attach The One Ring to it, Tempting side faceup. Use The Mirror of Galadriel - Gondor encounter set to build the encounter deck. Flip this card over and add it to the staging area.

name: The Ring Comes to Gondor
text: Each character gains the Gondor trait. Each character with the printed Gondor trait gets +1 hit point. Forced: After a Minas Tirith location is explored, place X [threat] tokens here, where X is its printed [threat].

name: Mirkwood Foes
text: Setup: Search your collection for the 10 enemies in the Dol Guldur Orcs and Spiders of Mirkwood encounter sets (from the Core Set). Remove Ungoliant’s Spawn from it. Set Chieftan Ufthak aside. Shuffle the remaining 8 cards together to create the Wave 1 deck. Set this card aside, then flip it over.

name: Commander of the Forest
text: When Revealed: Add Chieftan Ufthak to the staging area and attach Commander of the Forest to him. Counts as a Title attachment with the text: “Chieftan Ufthak is unique, gains the Wave 1 and Commander traits, and gets +2[pp] hit points. Forced: After an enemy engages a player, that player either retreats 2 or places 1 resource on Chieftan Ufthak. Forced: When Chieftan Ufthak is destroyed, remove Commander of the Forest from the game.”

name: Plundering Goblins
text: Setup: Search your collection for the 8 enemies in the Plundering Goblins encounter set (from Khazad-dûm). Shuffle them together to create the Wave 1 deck. Set this card aside, then flip it over.

name: Arûk Rhaín
text: X is 3 plus 2[pp]. To declare a character as a defender against an Orc enemy, the defending player must either spend 1 resource or retreat 3.

name: Brigands
text: Setup: Search your collection for the Brigands encounter set (from Heirs of Númenor). Shuffle it to create the Wave 1 deck. Set this card aside, then flip it over.

name: Torsea Stanomir
text: X is 3 plus 2[pp]. Forced: After a player optionally engages an enemy, they must either raise their threat by 3 or retreat 2.

name: Ravaging Orcs
text: Setup: Search your collection for the Ravaging Orcs encounter set (from Heirs of Númenor). Shuffle it to create the Wave 1 deck. Set this card aside, then flip it over.

name: Saltod, Orc Captain
text: X is 3 plus 2[pp]. Each Orc enemy cannot have more than 3 shadow cards dealt to it. Forced: After a shadow card with no shadow effect is flipped during an attack, the defending player either deals the attacking enemy an additional shadow card or retreats 2.

name: Misty Mountain Orcs
text: Setup: Search your collection for the Misty Mountain Orcs encounter set (from The Voice of Isengard). Remove 2x Orc Hunting Party from it. Shuffle the remaining cards together to create the Wave 1 deck. Set this card aside, then flip it over.

name: Zaca, Hunter of Whispers
text: X is 3 plus 2[pp]. Forced: When a player would remove a time token from the quest due to an Orc card effect, that player retreats 2 instead. This ability triggers even while Zaca, Hunter of Whispers is in the victory display.

name: Dunland Warriors
text: Setup: Search your collection for the Dunland Warriors encounter set (from The Voice of Isengard). Shuffle it to create the Wave 1 deck. Set this card aside, then flip it over.

name: Tharu, Deer Clan Founder
text: X is 3 plus 2[pp]. Forced: After a player draws any number of cards, that player retreats 1.

name: Harad Foes
text: Setup: Search your collection for 3x Umbar Sentry, 3x Southron Soldier, and 3x Southron Archer (from The Sands of Harad). Shuffle them together to create the Wave 1 deck. Set this card aside, then flip it over.

name: The Southron Champion
text: X is 3 plus 2[pp]. When a player would remove any amount of progress from the main quest due to a Harad enemy’s Forced effect, that player retreats by the same amount instead. This ability is active even while The Southron Champion is in the victory display.

name: Wild Creatures
text: Setup: Search your collection for the Wild Creatures encounter set (from The Wilds of Rhovanion or Ered Mithrin Campaign Expansion). Shuffle it to create the Wave 1 deck. Set this card aside, then flip it over.

name: Shelob’s Spawn
text: X is 3 plus 2[pp]. Each active location gains the Dark trait. Forced: After a character takes combat damage from a Creature enemy, that character’s controller retreats 2.

name: Dunlending Warriors
text: Setup: Search your collection for the 9 enemy cards in the Dunlending Warriors encounter set (from Children of Eorl). Set Dunland Chieftain aside. Shuffle the remaining 8 cards together to create the Wave 1 deck. Set this card aside, then flip it over.

name: The Bird Mantle
text: When Revealed: Add Dunland Chieftain to the staging area and attach The Bird Mantle to it. Counts as an attachment with the text: “Dunland Chieftain gains the Wave 1 and Commander traits and gets +1[pp] hit points. Forced: When Dunland Chieftain is destroyed, remove The Bird Mantle from the game.”

name: Orcs of Mordor
text: Setup: Search your collection for the Orcs of Mordor encounter set (from The Mountain of Fire or The Return of the King). Shuffle it to create the Wave 1 deck. Set this card aside, then flip it over.

name: Chieftain Shellûn
text: X is 3 plus 2[pp]. If The One Ring is ready and attached to a hero, Orc enemies get –1 [attack].

name: Wolf-cult
text: Setup: Search your collection for the Wolf-cult encounter set (from The Shire’s Reckoning). Shuffle it to create the Wave 1 deck. Set this card aside, then flip it over.

name: Salone Wolf-claw
text: X is 3 plus 2[pp]. Each enemy gains the text: “Last Gasp: Retreat 2.” (If an enemy has multiple Last Gasp effects, each one is triggered when the enemy is destroyed, in an order chosen by the first player.)

name: Dunland Raiders
text: Setup: Search your collection for the Dunland Raiders encounter set (from The Voice of Isengard). Shuffle it to create the Wave 2 deck. Set this card aside, then flip it over.

name: Chief Turch
text: X is 6 plus 4[pp]. Forced: After a player declares an attack against a Dunland enemy, they retreat X. X is half the number of cards in their hand (rounded up).

name: Angmar Orcs
text: Setup: Search your collection for the Angmar Orcs encounter set (from The Lost Realm or Angmar Awakened Campaign Expansion). Remove Orc Ambush from it. Shuffle the remaining cards together to create the Wave 2 deck. Set this card aside, then flip it over.

name: Grípswatch the Flayer
text: X is 6 plus 4[pp]. Forced: After a player declares a hero as a defender against an Orc enemy, that player must either retreat 2 or that enemy gets +2 [attack] for that attack.

name: Cursed Dead
text: Setup: Search your collection for the Cursed Dead encounter set (from The Lost Realm or Angmar Awakened Campaign Expansion). Remove Seal the Tomb from it. Shuffle the remaining cards together to create the Wave 2 deck. Set this card aside, then flip it over.

name: Dreaded Gravelord
text: X is 6 plus 4[pp]. Forced: After an Undead enemy engages a player, that player must either exhaust a character with 2 or more [willpower] or retreat 2.

name: Corsair Raiders
text: Setup: Search your collection for the Corsair Raiders encounter set (from The Grey Havens or The Dream-chaser Campaign Expansion). Shuffle it to create the Wave 2 deck. Search your collection for Captain Sahír from The Stormcaller Elite encounter set and set him aside. Set this card aside, then flip it over.

name: Raider Commander
text: When Revealed: Put Captain Sahír into play, enemy side faceup, and attach Raider Commander to him. Counts as a Title attachment with the text: “Captain Sahír gains the Wave 2 and Commander traits, and gets +4[pp] hit points. Forced: After any amount of resources is placed on an enemy engaged with a player, that player retreats by the same amount. Forced: When Captain Sahír is destroyed, remove Raider Commander from the game.”

name: Drowned Dead
text: Setup: Search your collection for the Drowned Dead encounter set (from The Grey Havens or The Dream-chaser Campaign Expansion). Remove 1 copy of Curse of the Downfallen from it. Shuffle the remaining cards together to create the Wave 2 deck. Set this card aside, then flip it over.

name: The Drowned King
text: X is 6 plus 4[pp]. Forced: After a player plays an ally with a printed cost of 2 or less, that player retreats 2.

name: Easterling Raiders
text: Setup: Search your collection for the Easterling Raiders encounter set (from A Shadow in the East). Remove Warriors of the East from it. Shuffle the remaining cards together to create the Wave 2 deck. Set this card aside, then flip it over.

name: Demitrik Osmar
text: X is 6 plus 4[pp]. Archery 1[pp]. Forced: After assigning damage from the archery keyword, each player retreats X. X is the amount of damage that player assigned to characters they control.

name: The Nazgûl
text: Setup: Search your collection for The Nazgûl encounter set (from The Black Riders or The Fellowship of the Ring). Remove 2x Power in their Terror from it. Set The Witch-king aside. Shuffle the remaining cards together to create the Wave 2 deck. Set this card aside, then flip it over.

name: Steel Crown
text: When Revealed: Exhaust The One Ring. Add The Witch-king to the staging area and attach Steel Crown to it. Counts as an attachment with the text: “The Witch-king gains the Wave 2 and Commander traits and gets +3[pp] hit points. The One Ring cannot ready. Forced: When The Witch-king is destroyed, add it to the victory display and remove Steel Crown from the game.”

name: Uruk-hai Foes
text: Setup: Search your collection for 4x Soldier of Isengard, 3x Isengard Uruk, and 3x Uruk-hai Fighter (from The Treason of Saruman or The Two Towers). Shuffle them together to create the Wave 2 deck. Search your collection for Uglúk from The Uruk-hai encounter set and set him aside. Set this card aside, then flip it over.

name: Uruk-hai Commander
text: When Revealed: Put Uglúk into play engaged with the first player and attach Uruk-hai Commander to him. Counts as a Title attachment with the text: “Uglúk gains the Wave 2 and Commander traits and gets +3[pp] hit points. Action: Any player may retreat X to give an enemy engaged with them –X toughness until the end of the phase. Forced: When Uglúk is destroyed, remove Uruk-hai Commander from the game.”

name: Orc-host
text: Setup: Search your collection for the 8 enemy cards in the Orc-host encounter set (from Children of Eorl). Set Orc Battalion aside. Shuffle the remaining 7 cards together to create the Wave 2 deck. Place Orc Battalion on the bottom of the Wave 2 deck (so that it will only be revealed in a 4 player game). Set this card aside, then flip it over.

name: Anzu, Horse-blood Drinker
text: X is 6 plus 4[pp]. Forced: After a player raises their threat by any amount, they retreat by the same amount.

name: Wolves
text: Setup: Search your collection for the Wolves encounter set (from The Shire’s Reckoning). Set Great Wolf aside. Shuffle the remaining cards together to create the Wave 2 deck. Set this card aside, then flip it over.

name: Darkling Dour-wolf
text: When Revealed: Put Great Wolf into play engaged with the first player and attach Darkling Dour-wolf to it. Counts as a Title attachment with the text: “Great Wolf gains the Wave 2 and Commander traits and gets +4[pp] hit points. Forced: When Great Wolf is destroyed, add it to the victory display and remove Darkling Dour-wolf from the game.”

name: Ruffians
text: Setup: Search your collection for the Ruffians encounter set (from The Shire’s Reckoning). Remove Ruffians on the Rise from it. Shuffle the remaining cards together to create the Wave 2 deck. Set this card aside, then flip it over.

name: Perp Lewis, Ardent Thug
text: X is 6 plus 4[pp]. A player cannot optionally engage a Brigand enemy unless they have an active location. Forced: After you engage a Brigand enemy, either retreat 2 or give your active location +2 [threat] until the end of the round.

name: The Dark Lord Beckons
text: Setup: Set aside Sauron from The Mirror of Galadriel - Sauron encounter set. Shuffle the remaining cards of that encounter set together to create the Villain deck. Flip this card over and add it to the staging area.

name: The Dark Lord Beckons
text: Forced: After The One Ring exhausts, add 1 [threat] token to The Dark Lord Beckons. Give Me the Ring (trigger only when instructed): The Ring-lord gains turncoat until the end of the game. Attach The One Ring to Sauron, Claimed side faceup.

name: The One Ring
text: Immune to non-Master player card effects. Attached hero is the Ring-lord, and its controller is the Ring-lord player. Response: After The One Ring attaches to a hero, choose a numerical value in that hero’s text box (not its attributes). It is considered to be double that value while The One Ring is attached. If The One Ring leaves play, the players lose the game.

name: The One Ring
text: Attached enemy gains formidable. Each character attacking the attached enemy cannot gain more than 5 [attack] from a single card effect. Forced: After attached enemy attacks you, retreat X. X is the amount of excess damage dealt by its attack.

name: Walls of Rammas
text: While Walls of Rammas is your active location, you must choose to optionally engage enemies you reveal through Siege of Middle-earth’s Forced effect, if able. Response: When Walls of Rammas is explored, the Ring-lord player may exhaust The One Ring to ignore the Forced effect on The Ring Comes to Gondor for this location.

name: The Great Gate
text: While The Great Gate is your active location, enemies engaged with you get –1 [attack]. While The Great Gate is in the victory display, players cannot travel to Level 0 locations.

name: Old Guesthouse
text: Travel: Raise your threat by 2. The Ring-lord player may exhaust The One Ring to have you search your deck for an ally with 0 [attack] or 0 [defense], put it into play under your control, and shuffle your deck.

name: Contested Courtyard
text: While Contested Courtyard is your active location, it gains: “Forced: After an enemy engages you, retreat 1.” Travel: Raise your threat by 2 and deal 1 damage to an enemy engaged with you. The Ring-lord player may exhaust The One Ring to deal 3 damage to that enemy instead.

name: Barracks
text: Travel: Raise your threat by 2. The Ring-lord player may exhaust The One Ring to have you search your deck for a non-unique Weapon or Armor attachment, attach it to an eligible character you control, and shuffle your deck.
shadow: Shadow: Discard an attachment you control.

name: Guard Tower
text: Guard Tower gets +X quest points. X is the [defense] of the attached ally. Travel: Raise your threat by 2 and attach an ally from your hand to Guard Tower. Attached ally is considered to be out of play. When Guard Tower is explored, discard the attached ally.

name: City Stable
text: Travel: Raise your threat by 2. The Ring-lord player may exhaust The One Ring to have you search your deck for a Mount attachment, attach it to an eligible character you control, and shuffle your deck.
shadow: Shadow: Either discard a Mount attachment you control, or attacking enemy gets +2 [attack].

name: Tower of Ecthelion
text: If the round number is 5 or 6, the next player with an opportunity to travel must travel here, if able. Forced: After Tower of Ecthelion is explored, the player who traveled to this location discards a hero they control. If Tower of Ecthelion was in the staging area when it was explored, the first player discards a hero. If there are any copies of Fall Back! in play, do not resolve them.

name: Clouds Over Pelennor
text: When Revealed: The players as a group must discard X resources. X is the number of locations in the staging area. If no resources were discarded this way, Clouds Over Pelennor gains surge.
shadow: Shadow: Attacking enemy gets +1 [attack] (+3 [attack] instead if you do not have an active location).

name: Fall Back!
text: When Revealed: Add Fall Back! to the staging area. The next time a location is explored, discard Fall Back! and search the encounter deck and discard pile for a location with a higher Level X trait than the explored location and reveal it. Shuffle the encounter deck. Only 1 copy of Fall Back! can trigger per explored location.

name: Man Every Wall!
text: When Revealed: Add Man Every Wall! to the staging area. At the end of the travel phase, discard Man Every Wall! and place 1 progress on each location in play. If at least one player does not have an active location, place 1 additional progress on each location in the staging area.
shadow: Shadow: Either retreat 2 or attacking enemy makes an additional attack against you after this one.

name: Weak Spot
text: When Revealed: The last player retreats 5. That player may raise their threat by X and distribute X damage among characters they control to reduce that retreat value by X.
shadow: Shadow: Attacking enemy gets +3 [attack]. You may retreat by X to reduce this value by X.

name: Sauron
text: X is 10 plus 6[pp]. Ring attachments cannot exhaust. Characters with 0 or 1 printed [willpower] gain deserter (they lose their Traits). When Revealed: Trigger Give Me the Ring on The Dark Lord Beckons. When Sauron is destroyed, the players win the game.

name: One Ring to Rule Them All
text: If the effect below is canceled, the player who revealed this card raises their threat by 10. When Revealed: The player who revealed this card chooses the deserter character they control with the highest [attack] (any character they control instead if they control no deserter characters). That character gains turncoat until the end of the game and makes an immediate attack.

name: The Lord of the Rings
text: If the effect below is canceled, the player who revealed this card raises their threat by 10. When Revealed: Sauron makes an immediate attack against the player who revealed this card. Deserter characters cannot be declared as defenders for this attack.

name: The Second Darkness
text: If the effect below is canceled, the player who revealed this card raises their threat by 10. When Revealed: The player who revealed this card deals 1 damage to each character they control, then they retreat 1 for each deserter character damaged in this way.

name: Tribute to the Dark Lord
text: If the effect below is canceled, the player who revealed this card raises their threat by 10. When Revealed: The player who revealed this card chooses the most common printed Trait among characters they control. That player discards half (rounded up) of the characters they control with the chosen printed Trait. Deserter characters must be discarded first.

name: The Gifts of Galadriel
text: Your deck must be exactly half allies and half attachments. Setup: Flip this card over.

name: The Gifts of Galadriel
text: Action: Play ally Galadriel from your hand for no cost. You do not need a resource match. Response: When you play or put into play an attachment, exhaust either Galadriel or The Gifts of Galadriel to attach it to a character that would be ineligible due to its Traits or resource icons. Then, either draw 1 card or add 1 resource to the pool of a hero you control. If another player now controls that attachment, do both instead. (Limit twice per round.)
